awd_abstract_narration: Fourier Transform Infrared (FTIR) spectroscopy is a technique                   that uses absorption of infrared energy to probe molecular                      structure.  The acquisition of an FTIR spectrophotometer is                     crucial for enhancing the research environment of the modern                    chemistry department.                                                                                                                                           The Department of Chemistry of the University of Wisconsin,                     Madison will use this award from the Chemistry Shared                           Instrumentation Program to help acquire an FTIR                                 spectrophotometer that will enhance research in three areas of                  chemistry which include the following:                                                                                                                          1) Mechanistic organometallic chemistry                                                                                                                         2) Luminescent properties of derivatized semiconductors                                                                                                         3) Synthetic organosilicon chemistry
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
